meanings.sent1: The teacher asked for our input on the project.
meanings.sent2: I need your input before I can finish this report.
meanings.sent3: The input of chocolate chips into the cookie dough made it taste even better.
meanings.sent4: Her input of creativity transformed the dull presentation into an engaging one.
meanings.sent5: The input of sunlight through the window brightened up the room.

meanings.definition: To enter data into a computer or other device.
meanings.sent1: Please input your password to access the system.
meanings.sent2: Remember to input the correct information into the form.
meanings.sent3: He tried to input his homework into the microwave instead of the computer.
meanings.sent4: She input her emotions into the music she composed.
meanings.sent5: The detective input the evidence into the database for analysis.

meanings.sent1: Feel free to input any suggestions you have for the project.
meanings.sent2: She always inputs valuable insights during our meetings.
meanings.sent3: The parrot tried to input its opinion during the conversation.
meanings.sent4: His input of humor lightened the mood in the room.
meanings.sent5: The team input their combined knowledge to solve the problem efficiently.
